name: berkeleygw

conflicts.name: +scalapack
conflicts.description: scalapack is a parallel library and needs MPI support

conflicts.name: +elpa
conflicts.description: elpa is a parallel library and needs MPI support

description:
BerkeleyGW is a many-body perturbation theory code for excited states,
using the GW method and the GW plus Bethe-Salpeter equation (GW-BSE)
method to solve respectively for quasiparticle excitations and optical
properties of materials.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software, generic shared ATLAS is an
approach for the automatic generation and optimization of numerical
software. Currently ATLAS supplies optimized versions for the complete
set of linear algebra kernels known as the Basic Linear Algebra
Subroutines (BLAS), and a subset of the linear algebra routines in the
LAPACK library.

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for
parallel distributed memory machines

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description: Virtual package for the Message Passing Interface.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: fftw-api
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: perl

Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
